Hi,

I'm currently wo=
rking on a project that has a reverse HTTP(S) proxy as a central component.=
 This proxy will shield multiple backend servers from direct access by clie=
nts. Currently it is planned for the reverse proxy to translate requests fo=
r

  https://proxy.example.com/{bakend-server}/{path} (1)

to

  http://{ba=
ckend-server}.localdomain/{path} (2)

As you can see the path of the URL is=
 altered by the proxy.

I wonder how hypermedia can be used in a RESTful wa=
y in such a setting. URIs in resource represenations for a client must be i=
n form (1). The client must not know anything about the backend servers. So=
 a resoure representation can not be in form (2). But a backend servers sho=
uld only know about form (2).

Example:

Resource represenation as seen on =
a backend server:

  {"title": "some resource", "uri": "http://foo.localdom=
ain/path/for/resource"} (3)

Resource representation as needed by a client:=


  {"title": "some resource", "uri": "http://proxy.example.com/foo/path/fo=
r/resource"} (4)

Where in the whole setup is represenation (3) translated =
into form (4) and back again?

What do you think?

Lutz
